intro: Xanthoselinum alsaticum subsp. venetum, commonly known as the Venetian goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
